items.label: Converting Onshape & STEP Files to glTF

getting-started/connect-live.title: Connecting to Live Sources
getting-started/connect-live.description: All visualizations in AdvantageScope are designed to receive live data from a robot or simulator in addition to log files. This section describes how to connect to real time data sources.

getting-started/keyboard.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
getting-started/keyboard.description: AdvantageScope includes numerous keyboard shortcuts that allow for faster navigation. Shortcuts that use the ctrl key are replaced by the ⌘ key on macOS.

getting-started/navigation.title: App Navigation
getting-started/navigation.description: The screenshot below shows the important elements of the main AdvantageScope window. The exact appearance differs between operating systems.

legal/nondiscrimination.title: Nondiscrimination
legal/nondiscrimination.description: Littleton STEM Educational Foundation (“Littleton Robotics”) is a registered 501(c)3 and welcomes all people without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, economic or family status, or any other life situation. We strive to be an inclusive environment for all individuals by advocating for and providing equity and social justice for everyone.

legal/privacy-policy.title: Privacy Policy
legal/privacy-policy.description: AdvantageScope is a volunteer-run project that is owned and published by the Littleton STEM Educational Foundation ("Littleton Robotics"), a non-profit organization based in the United States.

legal/support.title: Support
legal/support.description: To receive support for AdvantageScope or AdvantageScope XR, please use one of the contact methods below.

more-features/advantagescope-xr.title: AdvantageScope XR
more-features/advantagescope-xr.description: AdvantageScope XR is an experimental feature, and may not function properly on all devices. Please report any problems via the GitHub issues page, though note that during the season we always prioritize bug fixes that affect non-experimental features.

more-features/custom-assets.title: Custom Assets
more-features/custom-assets.description: AdvantageScope uses a default set of flat field images, field models, robot models, and joystick configurations. Simple assets (e.g. evergreen fields) are included in the initial installation. Detailed assets (e.g. season-specific fields) are downloaded automatically in the background when AdvantageScope is connected to the internet. To check the status of these downloads, click Help > Asset Download Status....

more-features/export.title: Exporting Log Data
more-features/export.description: AdvantageScope includes a flexible system for exporting log data as a CSV, WPILOG, or MCAP file. The export functions work when viewing a log file or when connected to a live data source. Possible use cases include:

more-features/gltf-convert.title: Converting Onshape & STEP Files to glTF
more-features/gltf-convert.description: AdvantageScope's 3D view accepts custom models for fields and robots, which can be installed using the process described here. All models must use the glTF file format, chosen for its efficiency when storing and loading models. Note that AdvantageScope uses the binary form (.glb), which includes all resources in a single file, rather than the pure JSON form (.gltf).

more-features/nt-publishing.title: Publishing NetworkTables Data
more-features/nt-publishing.description: AdvantageScope supports publishing NetworkTables data stored in a log file back to a NetworkTables server such as a simulator or robot. Possible use cases include:

more-features/phoenix-diagnostics.title: Phoenix Diagnostics
more-features/phoenix-diagnostics.description: AdvantageScope supports live-streaming of signals from Phoenix 6 devices with no setup in user code. This enables easy debugging and tuning of Phoenix devices using the familiar interface and full power of AdvantageScope:

more-features/urcl.title: Unofficial REV-Compatible Logger
more-features/urcl.description: Since REV does not provide an official method of automatically recording data from the Spark Max and Spark Flex, we have provided an unofficial alternative for Java and C++ called URCL (Unofficial REV-Compatible Logger). This enables live plotting and logging of all devices similar to CTRE's Tuner X plotting feature and Phoenix 6 signal logger.

more-features/zebra.title: Loading Zebra MotionWorks™ Data
more-features/zebra.description: This feature is powered by The Blue Alliance.

tab-reference/3d-field.title: 👀 3D Field
tab-reference/3d-field.description: The 3D field shows a 3D visualization of the robot and field. It can be used with regular 2D odometry, but is especially helpful when working with 3D calculations (like localizing with AprilTags). Multiple camera views are available, including field relative, robot relative, and fixed. AdvantageScope XR allows this tab to be visualized using augmented reality. The timeline shows when the robot is enabled and can be used to navigate through the log data.

tab-reference/console.title: 💬 Console
tab-reference/console.description: The console view is designed to view a single string field with console data. Some suggested fields are listed below.

tab-reference/joysticks.title: 🎮 Joysticks
tab-reference/joysticks.description: The joysticks tab shows the state of up to six connected controllers. The image below shows an example layout, with two Xbox controller and a generic joystick. Each button highlights when it is pressed, and the states of joysticks and other axes are displayed.

tab-reference/line-graph.title: 📉 Line Graph
tab-reference/line-graph.description: The line graph is the default view in AdvantageScope. It supports both continuous (numerical) and discrete fields.

tab-reference/mechanism.title: ⚙️ Mechanism
tab-reference/mechanism.description: The mechanism tab displays a a jointed mechanism created with one or more Mechanism2d objects.

tab-reference/metadata.title: 🔍 Metadata
tab-reference/metadata.description: The metadata tab shows values published to the hidden "/Metadata" table or through AdvantageKit. The metadata keys are displayed to the left, and the columns separate data from different sources (e.g. real and replay when using AdvantageKit).

tab-reference/odometry.title: 🗺 Odometry
tab-reference/odometry.description: The odometry tab shows a 2D visualization of the robot overlayed on a map of the field. It can also show extra data like vision targeting status and reference poses.

tab-reference/points.title: 📍 Points
tab-reference/points.description: The points tab shows a 2D visualization of arbitrary points. This is a very flexible tool, allowing for custom visualizations of vision data/pipelines, mechanism states, etc.

tab-reference/statistics.title: 📊 Statistics
tab-reference/statistics.description: The statistics tab allows for deep statistical analysis of numerical fields, analyzing overall trends rather than changes over time. The selected fields are analyzed using a histogram and a variety of standard statistical measures.

tab-reference/swerve.title: 🦀 Swerve
tab-reference/swerve.description: The swerve tab shows the state of four swerve modules, including the velocity vectors, idle positions, robot rotation, and chassis speeds.

tab-reference/table.title: 🔢 Table
tab-reference/table.description: The table view is designed to show the specific value changes for a set of fields in detail. To add a field, drag it to the main view. To delete a field, click the "X" button next to its name. Fields can be rearranged by clicking and dragging.

tab-reference/video.title: 🎬 Video
tab-reference/video.description: The video tab allows for the log data to be compared side-by-side with a match video that was separately recorded. The steps below show how to load a video and synchronize it with the log.

whats-new/legacy-formats.title: Legacy Format Deprecation
whats-new/legacy-formats.description: WPILib supports the type-safe and unit-safe struct format for publishing complex data types such as geometry objects, swerve states, and more! Starting in 2025, AdvantageScope takes advantage of the struct format to streamline the process of configuring fields for visualization. For example, 2D and 3D poses can now be used side-by-side on the 🗺 Odometry and 👀 3D Field tabs with no manual configuration and no unit errors.
